parameters.name: UT
parameters.description:
Universal Time in the ISO month/day          
      format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss where YYYY is the year, MM is the month, 
      DD is the day of month, T is literal, hh is the hour, mm in the minute, 
      and ss.sss is the second to millisecond resolution. The time stamp is   
      placed at the center of a 24 second moving average window that is       
      advanced by 12 seconds each sample.

parameters.name: Bx_VSO
parameters.description:
Bx VSO: The X-component of the magnetic      
      field in the Venus Solar Orbital System (VSO - GSE at Venus). The       
      system is Venus centered, with the X axis pointing instantaneously      
      from Venus to the Sun, the Z axis is perpendicular to the orbital       
     (ecliptic) plane of Venus positive 'up', and the Y axis completing       
      the right-handed set.

parameters.name: By_VSO
parameters.description:
By VSO: The Y-component of the magnetic      
      field in the Venus Solar Orbital System (VSO).

parameters.name: Bz_VSO
parameters.description:
BZ VSO: The Z-component of the magnetic      
      field in the Venus Solar Orbital System (VSO).

parameters.name: Bx_SC
parameters.description:
Bx SC: The X-component of the magnetic field 
      in the PVO Inertial Spacecraft Coordinate System (PVO_ISCC). This is    
      the component that lies in the sunward direction in the plane that      
      contains the Sun-spacecraft vector and the spacecraft spin axis. This   
      vector has been averaged over two spin periods from the high            
      resolution data.

parameters.name: By_SC
parameters.description:
By SC: The Y-component of the magnetic field 
      in the PVO Inertial Spacecraft Coordinate System (PVO_ISCC). The Y axis 
      is formed by the right-handed vector cross product of the X and Z unit  
      vectors where the Z axis is anti-parallel to the spacecraft spin axis   
      and the X-Z plane contains the Sun. This vector has been averaged over  
      two spin periods from the high resolution data.

parameters.name: Bz_SC
parameters.description:
Bz SC: The Z-component of the magnetic field 
      in the PVO Inertial Spacecraft Coordinate System (PVO_ISCC). The Z axis 
      is defined to be anti-parallel to the spacecraft spin axis during       
      orbital operations. This vector has been averaged over two spin         
      periods from the high resolution data.

parameters.name: Bt
parameters.description:
Bt: The vector magnitude of the averaged     
      field components.

parameters.name: VAR_Bx
parameters.description:
VAR Bx: Variance of the Bx SC over the       
      averaging window.

parameters.name: CVAR_Bxy
parameters.description:
CVAR Bxy: The covariance of Bx SC wrt By SC  
      over the averaging window.

parameters.name: CVAR_BZ
parameters.description:
CVAR Bxz: The covariance of Bx SC wrt Bz SC  
      over the averaging window.

parameters.name: VAR_By
parameters.description:
VAR By: Variance of the By SC over the       
      averaging window.

parameters.name: CVAR_Byz
parameters.description:
CVAR_Byz: The covariance of By SC wrt Bz SC  
      over the averaging window.

parameters.name: VAR_Bz
parameters.description:
VAR Bz: Variance of the Bz SC over the       
      averaging window.

parameters.name: VAR_Bt
parameters.description:
VAR Bt: Variance of the Bt SC over the       
      averaging window.

parameters.name: N
parameters.description:
N: The number of data points in the          
      magnetic field averages.

parameters.name: X_VSO
parameters.description:
X VSO: The X-component of the PVO spacecraft 
      position in Venus Solar Orbital Coordinates (VSO). The X component of   
      the VSO coordinate system is taken to be positive in the direction of   
      the Sun measured along the Venus- Sun line. The units are given in      
      Venus Radii where Rv = 6050 km.

parameters.name: Y_VSO
parameters.description:
Y VSO: The Y-component of the PVO spacecraft 
      position in Venus Solar Orbital Coordinates (VSO).The Y component of    
      the VSO coordinate system is taken to be positive in the direction      
      opposing orbital motion (dusk) and lying in the orbital plane of        
      Venus. The units given in Venus Radii where Rv = 6050 km.

parameters.name: Z_VSO
parameters.description:
Z VSO: The Z-component of the PVO spacecraft 
      position in Venus Solar Orbital Coordinates (VSO). The Z component of   
      the VSO coordinate system is taken to be parallel to the pole of the    
      Venus orbital plane and positive in the northward direction (upward     
      normal).  The units are given in Venus Radii where Rv = 6050 km.

parameters.name: ALT
parameters.description:
ALT: Spacecraft Altitude above the Venus     
      surface. This value is computed by subtracting 6050 km from the         
      centered Venus-to-PVO range given in the SEDR.

parameters.name: SZA
parameters.description:
SZA: Solar Zenith Angle. This is the three   
      body angle Sun-Venus-PVO taken from the SEDR.

parameters.name: LON
parameters.description:
LON: Venus centered longitude of the PVO     
      spacecraft.

parameters.name: LAT
parameters.description:
LAT: Venus centered latitude of the PVO      
      spacecraft.
